text:
There is something missing from all the quotes from @DefraGovUK  and the @EnvAgency on sewage discharges today, when it comes to the @RiverChess these recent events are in breach of the water companies temporary permit to discharge untreated sewage.
https://t.co/l2QBu8FSLi

We have existing legislation under which a very large proportion of these spills are already illegal. Most are in breach of their EA permits yet the EA does nothing to stop them. The first thing @DefraGovUK  should do is to make @EnvAgency do its job. https://t.co/04VNiwCYdV

It really does feel like a flood how it invades your home. Time for decisive action to protect our children @EnvAgency @MPGeorgeEustice https://t.co/tJG47ye491

RT @PJennings88: Makes very depressing reading but we suspect things are much worse than the figures show. The @EnvAgency  have a bizarre w‚Ä¶

RT @Feargal_Sharkey: @PJennings88 @EnvAgency @RiverChess But wait, government have a plan.

They're going to give water companies a legal d‚Ä¶

@PJennings88 @EnvAgency @RiverChess But wait, government have a plan.

They're going to give water companies a legal duty to publish the sewage data. Oops they already have a legal duty, from 2015, see Fish Legal v Information Commissioner. (1./2)
